intro: Chysis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican chysis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing at the base of the leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
